name: Tattered Hat
desc: Itchy and filthy, it offers almost no protection

name: Tattered Shirt
desc: A standard-issue peasant shirt

name: Tattered Pants
desc: Not comfy. Not protective.

name: Worn Gloves
desc: The gloves of a worker. They offer little-to-know actual defense.

name: Farmer's Boots
desc: Farmers don't normally fight horrific monsters, so these aren't exactly reassuring.

name: Cook's Ring
desc: A cook's best friend, this little trinket offers defense against not checking your stovetop before touching it.

name: Boiled Leather Cuirass
desc: While not as protective as a metal chestpiece, this armor is much lighter. It's also a lot more brittle, so try not to get hit.

name: Boiled Leather Leggings
desc: Sometimes quick movement is preferable to standing there and getting hit. Boiled leather armor goes that route. Also, the curing process makes it smell a bit like piss. So there's that.

name: Weekend Shirt
desc: You wore this last time you were out with the bros. It's pretty dank.

name: Parachute Pants
desc: The 1980's called. They want their pants back.

name: Gardening Gloves
desc: These aren't exactly designed for fighting monsters. Unless by 'monsters', you mean weeds, and by 'fighting', you mean tending Grandma's veggie patch.

name: Sneakers from the Back of the Closet
desc: You know, that pair that you haven't seen in years. Really comfy, but also really weak.

name: Mets Hat
desc: Show your support for the New York Mets! Keep the sun out of your face! Protect against pretty much nothing!

name: Hardened Leather Skullcap
desc: A mid-level helmet, this skullcap will protect you from minor boo-boos.

name: Hardened Leather Breastplate
desc: Not nearly as protective as metal armor, but a lot more comfy.

name: Hardened Leather Leggings
desc: They chafe a bit. They also protect your sensitive areas a bit, so that's good.

name: Hardened Leather Bracers
desc: Via a complex curing process involving many nasty chemicals, the original cow hide is transformed into something that makes digging the weeds a lot easier.

name: Hardened Leather Greaves
desc: They kinda smell after a while.

name: Cleric Robes
desc: So holy you can feel the self-righteousness oozing off of them.

name: Robes of the Damned
desc: Damn, these are nice robes!

name: Steel Brigandine
desc: Made from tempered steel, it makes you feel all nice and safe.

name: Steel Greaves
desc: Large, metal boots certainly don't make you stealthy. But who needs stealthy when you've got large, metal boots?

name: Steel Gauntlets
desc: The tempered steel of these gauntlets provides important protection against crushed fingers, but also makes drawing rude things on your enemy after battle much more difficult.

name: Steel Chauses
desc: Because getting kicked in the groin is really just not that fun

name: Steel Cervelliere
desc: The decision not to use facial protection is a trade off: much higher visibility and breathability, but also a much higher chance of getting decked in the face.
